title: ESA Awards €350M to Avio to Boost Vega C and Develop Vega E
summary:
The European Space Agency has awarded Avio two contracts worth a total of €350 million to boost the launch cadence of Vega C and to complete the development of the company’s next-gen Vega E rocket. Vega E is a planned three-stage rocket that is expected to be introduced in 2027. It will retain the first […]

title: U.S. military seeks commercial space technology for strategic edge
summary:
The Pentagon wants to leverage commercial space technology to enhance military capabilities, even as officials work to address longstanding challenges in government-industry collaboration.

title: Firefly, ispace lunar landers to share Falcon 9 launch
summary:
Japanese lunar lander developer ispace has confirmed that its second mission will launch on the same Falcon 9 as Firefly’s first lunar lander.

title: More NASA Science, Tech will Fly to Moon Aboard Future Firefly Flight
summary: NASA continues to advance its campaign to explore more of the Moon than ever before, awarding Firefly Aerospace $179 million to deliver six experiments to the lunar surface. title: NASA Payload Aims to Probe Moon’s Depths to Study Heat Flow
summary: Earth’s nearest neighboring body in the solar system is its Moon, yet to date humans have physically explored just 5% of its surface. title: NASA Knows: How Does the Sun Behave? (Grades 5-8)
summary: This article is for students grades 5-8. The Sun is the star of our solar system. Its gravity holds Earth and our planetary neighbors in its orbit. At 865,000 miles (1.4 million km) in diameter, it’s the largest object in our solar system. On Earth, its influence is felt in our weather, seasons, climate, and […]
